meaningMnemonic: You have a <radical>samurai</radical> with a <radical>flag</radical> on a <radical>stick</radical>. On his flag is the symbol 声, the kanji for <kanji>voice</kanji>. Why does he have that there? He feels like his Shogun isn't giving him and his fellow Samurai a voice, so he's brought a flag with the word "voice" written on it to protest.
readingMnemonic: You decide to join the samurai’s protest for more <vocabulary>voice</vocabulary> but immediately notice… they’re all <reading>子, eh</reading> (こえ)?!
